shared

Interface IServer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ServerProxy
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GameServer, MockProxy

    public interface IServer
    Created by elijahgk on 9/12/2016. Interface to be implemented in ServerProxy and MockProxy classes. Implements the Catan Server API commands.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ClientModel acceptTrade(AcceptTradeAction acceptTradeObject)
      Method considers if player has accepted the offer and then swaps specified resources if true
      void addAI(AddAIRequest addAIObject)
      Adds an AI player to the current game.
      ClientModel buildCity(BuildCityAction buildCityObject)
      Builds a city on game map if player is able

      Builds a road on the game map if player is able

      Buys a development card from the deck if any are left and if you have enough resources.

    • Method Detail

      • login

        void login(@NotNull
           Credentials credentialsObject)
    throws javax.security.auth.login.CredentialNotFoundException,
           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
           javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Method checks if the login credentials are valid. Throws exception if there are any problems or conflicts.
        Parameters:
        credentialsObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. Contains the username and password of the player.
        Throws:
        javax.security.auth.login.CredentialNotFoundException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        The username and password are valid.
        Postcondition:
        The login operation is successful and the user session is being tracked.

      • register

        void register(@NotNull
              Credentials credentialsObject)
       throws javax.security.auth.login.CredentialNotFoundException,
              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
              javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Method register a new user if the user name is not used, logs the caller in to the server, and sets their catan.user HTTP cookie
        Parameters:
        credentialsObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. Contains the username and password of the player.
        Throws:
        javax.security.auth.login.CredentialNotFoundException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        The crediantials are are valid and have not already been used.
        Postcondition:
        A new user is registered on the server and the user session is being tracked.

                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Method returns info about all of the current games on the server
        Returns:
        The list of GameInfo objects that are running on the server.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        None
        Postcondition:

      • createGame

        void createGame(@NotNull
                CreateGameRequest createGameObject)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Creates a new game on the server
        Parameters:
        createGameObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        name is not null and randomTiles, randomNumbers, and randomPorts contain valid boolean values
        Postcondition:
        A new game is created on the server

      • joinGame

        void joinGame(@NotNull
              JoinGameRequest joinGameObject)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
              javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Adds a player to a specific game and sets their catan.game cookie
        Parameters:
        joinGameObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request.
        Throws:
        JoinGameException - if the JoinGameRequest does not allow the player to join.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        • The user has previously logged in to the server
        • There is space in the game to add a new player.
        • The specified game ID is valid
        • The specified color is valid
        Postcondition:
        The current Player has been added to the specified game with the specified color.

      • saveGame

        void saveGame(@NotNull
              SaveGameRequest saveGameObject)
       throws javax.naming.CommunicationException,
              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        For testing and debugging. Save a game with a bug report for others to fix
        Parameters:
        saveGameObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request.
        Throws:
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Precondition:
        SaveGameRequest contains a valid file name and game ID.
        Postcondition:
        The current state of the specified game (including its ID) has been saved to the specified file name in the serverâ€™s saves/ directory.

      • loadGame

        void loadGame(@NotNull
              LoadGameRequest loadGameObject)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
              javax.naming.CommunicationException
        For testing and debugging. Loads a game that was saved with a bug report for fixing purposes
        Parameters:
        loadGameObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes the file name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        LoadGameRequest contains a valid file name.
        Postcondition:
        The game in the specified file has been loaded into the server and its state restored (including its ID).

      • gameState

        ClientModel gameState(int version)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Returns the current state of the game
        Parameters:
        version - If needed, a version number is needed in the URL; null is valid
        Returns:
        The current game state, or null if one does not exist
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        • User is logged in and in a game.
        • version is a valid integer
        Postcondition:
        None

      • resetGame

        ClientModel resetGame()
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Clears the command history of the current game (not the players)
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        Caller is logged in and joined a game.
        Postcondition:
        Command list is cleared

      • getCommandsGame

        java.lang.String[] getCommandsGame()
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                   javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Returns a list of commands that have been executed in the current game. Used for testing and debugging.
        Returns:
        List of all game commands that have been executed since the setup round of the game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        Caller is logged in and joined a game.
        Postcondition:
        None.

      • postCommandsGame

        ClientModel postCommandsGame(@NotNull
                             java.lang.String[] gameCommands)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Executes the specified command list in the current game. Used for testing and debugging.
        Parameters:
        gameCommands - The game commands that have been executed in the current game.
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        Caller is logged in and joined a game.
        Postcondition:
        The passed-in command list has been applied to the game.

      • addAI

        void addAI(@NotNull
           AddAIRequest addAIObject)
    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
           javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Adds an AI player to the current game. You must login and join a game before calling this method
        Parameters:
        addAIObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This contains an AI type
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        Caller is logged in and joined a game, there is space for another player, AddAIRequest contains a valid AI type.
        Postcondition:
        A new AI player of the specified type has been added to the current game.

                    ChangeLogLevelRequest changeLogLevelObject)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                    javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Sets the server's logging level
        Parameters:
        changeLogLevelObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes a valid logging value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        LogLevel is a valid logging level
        Postcondition:
        The Server is using the specified logging level.

        ClientModel sendChat(@NotNull
                     SendChatAction sendChatObject)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Sends a chat message to the other players anytime
        Parameters:
        sendChatObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This contains a type, the player index, and the content of the chat
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        None
        Postcondition:
        Chat contains your message at the end

      • acceptTrade

        ClientModel acceptTrade(@NotNull
                        AcceptTradeAction acceptTradeObject)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Method considers if player has accepted the offer and then swaps specified resources if true
        Parameters:
        acceptTradeObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes the player index and whether they are accepting or not
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        player is offered a domestic trade.
        Postcondition:
        If you accepted, you and the player who offered swap the specified resources, If you declined no resources are exchanged, The trade offer is removed

      • discardCards

        ClientModel discardCards(@NotNull
                         DiscardCardsAction discardCardsObject)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Method that discards cards from a players hand.
        Parameters:
        discardCardsObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes the player index and the cards they are discarding.
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        Caller has the cards that he is trying to discard.
        Postcondition:
        Caller no longer has the cards defined in DiscardCardsAction.

      • rollNumber

        ClientModel rollNumber(@NotNull
                       RollNumberAction rollNumberObject)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Tells the server what number you have rolled
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        It is your turn and the client's model status is 'rolling'
        Postcondition:
        The client model's status is now in 'Discarding', 'Robbing', or 'Playing'

      • buildRoad

        ClientModel buildRoad(@NotNull
                      BuildRoadAction buildRoadObject)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Builds a road on the game map if player is able
        Parameters:
        buildRoadObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes a valid location, player index, and whether it is free
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        caller canBuildRoad. BuildRoadAction is valid.
        Postcondition:
        If !free, lose the required resources. The road is now on the map in the correct location. Player loses 1 road. Longest road has been applied, if applicable.

      • buildSettlement

        ClientModel buildSettlement(@NotNull
                            BuildSettlementAction buildSettlementObject)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Builds a settlement on game map if player is able
        Parameters:
        buildSettlementObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes a valid location, player index, and whether the settlement is free
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        Caller canBuildSettlement. BuildSettlementAction is valid
        Postcondition:
        Lose required resources (if !free). The settlement has been placed on specified location. Player loses 1 settlement.

      • buildCity

        ClientModel buildCity(@NotNull
                      BuildCityAction buildCityObject)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Builds a city on game map if player is able
        Parameters:
        buildCityObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes a valid location and player index.
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        Caller canBuildCity. BuildCityAction is valid.
        Postcondition:
        Lose required resources. City is placed on specified location. Player receives 1 settlement back and loses 1 city.

      • offerTrade

        ClientModel offerTrade(@NotNull
                       OfferTradeAction offerTradeObject)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Offers cards to trade with other players. If successful, offer is sent to other player
        Parameters:
        offerTradeObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes the player index, the resources being offered, and the index of the receiving player
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        Player has the resources they are offering. OfferTradeAction is valid.
        Postcondition:
        The trade is offered to the other player (stored in server model).

      • maritimeTrade

        ClientModel maritimeTrade(@NotNull
                          MaritimeTradeAction maritimeTradeObject)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Trades in your resources for resources offered by harbor.
        Parameters:
        maritimeTradeObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes the player index, and , optionally, the ratio, input resource and output resource.
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        Player has resources they are trading in. For ratios less than 4, you have the correct port for the trade.
        Postcondition:
        The trade has been executed (resources offered by player are now in bank, requiested resources are received by player).

      • robPlayer

        ClientModel robPlayer(@NotNull
                      RobPlayerAction robPlayerObject)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Player gets to move robber to new location and target another player to rob
        Parameters:
        robPlayerObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes the player index, the vitim index and the new location of the robber.
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        The robber is not being kept in the same location. If a player is being robbed, then that player has resources.
        Postcondition:
        The robber is in the new specified location. The play being robbed (if any) has given robbing player 1 random resource.

      • finishTurn

        ClientModel finishTurn(@NotNull
                       FinishMoveAction finishMoveObject)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       javax.naming.CommunicationException
        This method ends your turn and moves the game to the next player. It also puts your new development card hand into you old hand.
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        None
        Postcondition:
        The cards in the newDevHand have been transferred to the oldDevHand

      • buyDevCard

        ClientModel buyDevCard(@NotNull
                       BuyDevCardAction buyDevCardObject)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Buys a development card from the deck if any are left and if you have enough resources.
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        Player has required resources. There are dev cards left in the bank.
        Postcondition:
        Player has a new dev card in 1) oldDevHand if monument; in newDevHand otherwise.

      • useSoldier

        ClientModel useSoldier(@NotNull
                       SoldierAction soldierObject)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Player gets to move robber to new location and target another player to rob
        Parameters:
        soldierObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes the player index, the vitim index and the new location of the robber.
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        The robber is not being kept in same location. The player being robbed (if any) has resource cards.
        Postcondition:
        Robber is moved. Player being robbed (if any) has given player a resource card at random. Largest army is transferred (if applicable). Cannot play other dev cards this turn.

      • useYearOfPlenty

        ClientModel useYearOfPlenty(@NotNull
                            YearofPlentyAction yearOfPlentyObject)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Play the year of plenty card to gain two resources of your choice.
        Parameters:
        yearOfPlentyObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes the player index and the two specified resources.
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        The two specified resources are in the bank.
        Postcondition:
        Player has gained two specified resources.

      • useRoadBuilding

        ClientModel useRoadBuilding(@NotNull
                            RoadBuildingAction roadBuildingObject)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Play the road building card to build two new roads, if available
        Parameters:
        roadBuildingObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes the player index and the two edge locations to place the road.
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        First road location is connected to one of player's other roads. Second location is connected as well (can be connected to first road). Neither road is on water. Player has two unused roads.
        Postcondition:
        Play has two fewer unused roads. Roads are placed at specified location. Longest road is transferred (if applicable).

      • useMonopoly

        ClientModel useMonopoly(@NotNull
                        MonopolyAction monopolyObject)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Play the monopoly card to take all of one type of resource from all other players
        Parameters:
        monopolyObject - The information that needs to be added to the body of the HTTP request. This includes the player index and the resource type.
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        None
        Postcondition:
        All other players have given you all of their resource cards of one specified type.

      • useMonument

        ClientModel useMonument(@NotNull
                        MonumentAction monumentObject)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Play your monument cards to gain victory point and win the game.
        Parameters:
        monumentObject - The information to be included in the HTTP request. This includes the player index.
        Returns:
        The ClientModel of the current game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        javax.naming.CommunicationException
        Precondition:
        Player will win after having played all of their monument cards.
        Postcondition:
        You gain victory point(s).
